snippet: Those who want to see it rise to $15 might end up harming some of the people they hope to help.
abstract: Op-Ed article by economist Alan B Krueger cautions that raising federal minimum wage to $15 an hour carries risk of negatively impacting labor market, although it is unclear what would happen given that it is unprecedented; points to research that suggests gradual rise to federal minimum wage of $12 per hour would carry little to no risk in affecting jobs.
lead_paragraph: Those who want to see it rise to $15 might end up harming some of the people they hope to help.

headline.main: The Minimum Wage: How Much Is Too Much?
